title: 2013 Rare Drops

properties.name: description
properties.value: The 2013 Rare Drops were a series of events from 3 June until 9 September that were the first introduction of most holiday items in Old School RuneScape. The event primarily consisted of random item spawns around the world that would change each week to provide a different set of rewards. Later updates also included social media posts containing clues to the locations of the drops.

2013 Rare Drops
Please add an image!
Released 3 June 2013 - Update Unknown (edit)
End date 9 September 2013 - Update Unknown (edit)
Preceded by N/A
Succeeded by N/A

The 2013 Rare Drops were a series of events from 3 June until 9 September that were the first introduction of most holiday items in Old School RuneScape. The event primarily consisted of random item spawns around the world that would change each week to provide a different set of rewards. Later updates also included social media posts containing clues to the locations of the drops.

Throughout the event, it was stated by Mod Mat K that the holiday rewards would not be rare, because they would continue to be made available during their respective holidays in future years. Despite this, many of the tradeable holiday rewards were briefly very valuable in the first days following their drops.

Contents

  • 1 Random spawns
  • 2 Easter egg hunt
  • 3 Falador Party Room Santa hats
  • 4 Cracker Jack clue hunt
    • 4.1 September 2
    • 4.2 September 3
    • 4.3 September 4
    • 4.4 September 5
    • 4.5 September 6
    • 4.6 September 7
    • 4.7 September 8
  • 5 References

Random spawns[edit | edit source]

During the event, rare items would spawn randomly around the world. Each item would be available for approximately one week before getting replaced by the next set of items. The item change would occur at 1am BST, usually on each Monday.

The items had approximately 100 fixed spawn locations across the entire map, and 1 would be active at a time. When the item was picked up, it would immediately spawn at one of the other locations. Only 1 player would be able to pick up a given spawn. When items were visible on the ground, there would be fireworks and firework sound effects playing, and there would not be a red dot on the minimap like a normal item.

When picking up tradeable items, a message would appear saying You have found a tradeable rare item. If you lose it, you will not be able to get a replacement.

For untradeable items, the message would instead say You have found an untradeable rare item. If you lose it, you can get it back from Diango. If the player had already obtained an untradeable item, the message would read You already have that item. You don't need another.

Spawn Items Start date End date
Scythe 3 June 10 June
Pumpkin 10 June 17 June
Red h'ween Mask 17 June 24 June
Blue h'ween Mask
Green h'ween Mask
Skeleton outfit 24 June 1 July
Jack lantern mask
Yo-yo 1 July 8 July
Red partyhat 4 July 14 July
Yellow partyhat
Blue partyhat
Green partyhat
Purple partyhat
White partyhat
Bunny ears 14 July 21 July
Reindeer hat
Easter egg 21 July 28 July
Easter ring 28 July 5 August
Marionette set
Santa hat 5 August 12 August
Wintumber tree
Rubber chicken 12 August 19 August
Hats & scarves
Disk of Returning 19 August 26 August
Chicken suit
Zombie head 26 August 2 September
Half full wine jug
Christmas cracker 2 September 9 September
War ship

Partyhats were released 3 days early, making them available for a total of 10 days.

Easter egg hunt[edit | edit source]

Starting 23 July, an easter egg spawn would appear in a fixed location each day that could be picked up by multiple players. For each of the next 7 days, the egg would appear in a different location. Clues for the locations were posted on social media.

Easter eggs continued to be available during this week from the random spawns around the world.

Day MapLink Location
1 23 July Location Near the Tower of Life
2 24 July Location Tyras Camp
3 25 July Location Death Plateau
4 26 July Location Uzer
5 27 July Location Center of the Lava Maze (wilderness level 44)
6 28 July Unknown (edit) Khazari jungle south of shilo village, south-west next to skeleton remains where the saradomin wizard clue scroll is
7 29 July Location East house in Rimmington

Falador Party Room Santa hats[edit | edit source]

Beginning 5 August, santa hats were made available as drops from the Falador Party Room. By adding coins or various other holiday rewards to the chest, santa hats would be automatically added and be dropped by the party balloons. The number of santa hats depended on which items were added to the chest.

  • 100k Cash = 1 santa hat spawn
  • Easter egg = 3 santa hats spawn
  • Halloween mask = 4 santa hats spawn
  • Party hat = 5 santa hats spawn

The other items added to the chest would not be consumed, and would also be dropped in random party balloons. With cooperation, large numbers of santa hats could be obtained by putting the same holiday items in the chest repeatedly.

Santa hats continued to also be available during this week from the random spawns around the world.

Cracker Jack clue hunt[edit | edit source]

Each day from September 2nd to September 8th, clues were left on Old School RuneScape's official social media platforms that could be used to get a single Christmas cracker in game. Each day, at least two clues would be put out, usually on Facebook and Twitter. The clues would consist of text and images and mentioned "Cracker Jack". In order to claim the daily Christmas cracker, players had to determine which NPC to talk to and what items they needed to have in their inventory. The night of September 1st, a YouTube video introducing the clue hunt was posted on the official Old School RuneScape account titled Cryptic Clue Fest - Cracker Jack has a message for you!.[1]

September 2[edit | edit source]

On the first day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to Dommik with a hammer, three tin ore, and six clay in their inventory. [4] The clue posted to Facebook indicated the numbers of each item that was needed as well as the first letter of each required item, while the clue posted to Twitter indicated that the player needed to talk to Dommik in Al Kharid. The numbers for each item may come from the fact that 1, 3, and 6 are the first three nonzero triangle numbers.

September 3[edit | edit source]

“ Slog around a board with a sun tanned snail about these items ~ Cracker Jack http://ow.ly/ou8Ah ”
 
— Old School RuneScape's Twitter account [6]

On the second day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to Advisor Ghrim with two planks, six logs, and ten bronze nails in their inventory. [7] The image posted to Facebook indicated the approximate location of the NPC to talk to, upstairs Miscellania Castle, while the cryptic clue posted to Twitter indicated the items: slog around->logs anagrammed, "board"->plank as a synonym, "sun tanned"->bronze as a synonym, and "snail about"->nails anagrammed.

September 4[edit | edit source]

On the third day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to TzHaar-Ket-Zuh in Mor Ul Rek with one coal, three iron bars, and four limestone in their inventory. [10] This was the only day without a clue on Twitter and instead featured a clue on the official blogspot consisting of just an image. The Facebook clue indicated the items required by showing images over mines, the pickaxe over the Coal Truck indicates coal, the pickaxe and anvil indicate iron bars, and the pickaxe and chisel over the Limestone Mine indicate the limestone. The blogspot clue indicates that the player needs to talk to the TzHaar banker.

September 5[edit | edit source]

On the fourth day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to Barker in Canifis with one leather, two balls of wool, and five silk in their inventory. [13]

September 6[edit | edit source]

“ 50 under me initially over the rough big red company ok? ~ Cracker Jack http://ow.ly/oBVV3 ”
 
— Old School RuneScape's Twitter account [15]

On the fifth day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to the Lumbridge cook with two chef's hats, two white aprons, and twelve knives in their inventory. [16]

September 7[edit | edit source]

On the sixth day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to the Ardougne baker with two pots of flour, three cheese and six tomatoes in their inventory. [19]

September 8[edit | edit source]

On the last day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to Emily in the Rising Sun Inn with one bucket of water, four redberries, and five cooking apples in their inventory. This was the only day where two clues were released on Facebook. These were accompanied by a clue on Twitter. [23]

References[edit | edit source]

[[File:Cracker Jack - Day 2 clue Facebook.png|middle|200px| {{CiteGeneral |url=https://www.facebook.com/OfficialOldSchoolRuneScape/photos/a.156917831144723/199950110174828 |title=Old School RuneScape's Facebook account |author=Jagex |date=2013-09-03 |accessdate=2021-08-26 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/eGKTk |archivedate=4 September 2021 |quote=Cracker jack has a message for you! http://ow.ly/ou8OA}}]] {{Cquote2|Slog around a board with a sun tanned snail about these items ~ Cracker Jack http://ow.ly/ou8Ah|Old School RuneScape's Twitter account| {{CiteTwitter |author=Old School RuneScape |url=https://twitter.com/OldSchoolRS/status/374683420657717248 |date=3 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/duHg7 |archivedate=18 August 2021 |quote=Slog around a board with a sun tanned snail about these items ~ Cracker Jack http://ow.ly/ou8Ah}}}}
On the second day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to [[Advisor Ghrim]] with two [[plank]]s, six [[logs]], and ten [[bronze nails]] in their inventory. {{CiteGeneral |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mkt0GVXkB3o |title=Day 2/7 Christmas Cracker - Cryptic Clue - Runescape 2007 Old School Runescape |author=Smokey9112Films |date=2013-09-03 |accessdate=2021-09-10}} The image posted to Facebook indicated the approximate location of the NPC to talk to, upstairs [[Miscellania Castle]], while the cryptic clue posted to Twitter indicated the items: slog around->logs anagrammed, "board"->plank as a synonym, "sun tanned"->bronze as a synonym, and "snail about"->nails anagrammed. ===September 4===
[[File:Cracker Jack - Day 3 clue Facebook.jpeg|middle|200px| {{CiteGeneral |url=https://www.facebook.com/OfficialOldSchoolRuneScape/photos/a.156917831144723/200228876813618 |title=Old School RuneScape's Facebook account |author=Jagex |date=4 September 2013 |accessdate=4 September 2021 |archivedate=4 September 2021 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/Ircpg |quote=Cracker Jack has another clue for you. Solve the clues to get a Christmas cracker! http://services.runescape.com/m=forum/forums.ws?317,318,72,65139239}}]] [[File:Cracker Jack - Day 3 clue Blogspot.png|middle|200px| {{CiteGeneral |author=Unknown |url=http://oldschoolrscommunity.blogspot.com/2013/09/cracker-jack-has-message-for-you.html |title=Official blogspot post |date=2 September 2013 |archivedate=4 September 2021 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/jKFlh}}]]
On the third day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to [[TzHaar-Ket-Zuh]] in [[Mor Ul Rek]] with one [[coal]], three [[iron bars]], and four [[limestone]] in their inventory. {{CiteGeneral |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8QT89od_pTg |title=Christmas Cracker Cyptic Clue Guide Day 3 Oldschool Runescape |author=Sponge Gaming |date=2013-09-04 |accessdate=2021-09-10}} This was the only day without a clue on Twitter and instead featured a clue on the official blogspot consisting of just an image. The Facebook clue indicated the items required by showing images over mines, the pickaxe over the [[Coal Truck]] indicates coal, the pickaxe and anvil indicate iron bars, and the pickaxe and chisel over the [[Limestone Mine]] indicate the limestone. The blogspot clue indicates that the player needs to talk to the TzHaar banker. ===September 5===
[[File:Cracker Jack - Day 4 clue Facebook.png|middle|200px| {{CiteGeneral |url=https://www.facebook.com/OfficialOldSchoolRuneScape/photos/a.156917831144723/200484483454724 |title=Old School RuneScape's Facebook account |author=Jagex |date=5 September 2013 |accessdate=4 September 2021 |archivedate=4 September 2021 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/gL4UI |quote=Cracker Jack says 'Hi" to everyone! http://ow.ly/oy64p}}]] [[File:Cracker Jack - Day 4 clue Twitter.jpeg|middle|200px| {{CiteTwitter |author=Old School RuneScape |url=https://twitter.com/OldSchoolRS/status/375408416875089922 |date=5 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/a6Ebn |archivedate=18 August 2021 |quote=Cracker Jack is back with a new message for you! http://ow.ly/oy9If}}]]
On the fourth day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to [[Barker]] in [[Canifis]] with one [[leather]], two [[balls of wool]], and five [[silk]] in their inventory. {{CiteGeneral |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EViW5baZ5eo |title=How to get a free Christmas cracker and party hat on oldschool runescape day 4 thursday |author=sliceanddicedyou |date=2013-09-05 |accessdate=2021-09-10}} ===September 6===
[[File:Cracker Jack - Day 5 clue Facebook.png|middle|200px| {{CiteGeneral |url=https://www.facebook.com/OfficialOldSchoolRuneScape/photos/a.156917831144723/201084856728020 |title=Old School RuneScape's Facebook account |author=Jagex |date=6 September 2013 |accessdate=4 September 2021 |archivedate=4 September 2021 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/jpj8C |quote=Cracker Jack has another clue for you! http://ow.ly/oAPiZ}}]] {{Cquote2|50 under me initially over the rough big red company ok? ~ Cracker Jack http://ow.ly/oBVV3|Old School RuneScape's Twitter account| {{CiteTwitter |author=Old School RuneScape |url=https://twitter.com/OldSchoolRS/status/375773496926040064 |date=6 September 2013 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/OBiN6 |archivedate=18 August 2021 |quote=50 under me initially over the rough big red company ok? ~ Cracker Jack http://ow.ly/oBVV3}}}}
On the fifth day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to the [[Cook (Lumbridge)|Lumbridge cook]] with two [[chef's hat]]s, two [[white apron]]s, and twelve [[knife|knives]] in their inventory. {{CiteGeneral |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jI-xltNi-es |title=Day 5/7 Christmas Cracker - Cryptic Clue - Runescape 2007 Old School Runescape |author=Smokey9112Films |date=2013-09-06 |accessdate=2021-09-10}} ===September 7===

On the sixth day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to the [[Baker|Ardougne baker]] with two [[pots of flour]], three [[cheese]] and six [[tomato]]es in their inventory. {{CiteGeneral |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u9NG1RObFpc |title=How to get a free christmas cracker and partyhat on oldschool runescape day 6 saturday |author=sliceanddicedyou |date=2013-09-07 |accessdate=2021-09-10}} ===September 8===

On the last day of the event, players could claim a Christmas cracker by talking to [[Emily]] in the [[Rising Sun Inn]] with one [[bucket of water]], four [[redberries]], and five [[cooking apple]]s in their inventory. This was the only day where two clues were released on Facebook. These were accompanied by a clue on Twitter. {{CiteGeneral |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MK_T3V9QDLs |title=how to get todays christmas cracker on oldschool runescape sunday day 7 |author=sliceanddicedyou |date=2013-09-08 |accessdate=2021-09-10}} {{clear|both}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{2013 Rare Drops}} {{Events}}
